Example.Description: This example shows the ref function returns the value of the Dictionary through the index reference. This example uses the (ref aDictionary index1) function syntax.

Syntax.Note: The ref function returns the value with the index 0 in the Dictionary.
The ref function returns the value with the index 1 in the Dictionary.
The ref function returns the value with the index 2 in the Dictionary.
Syntax.Hints: Since Dictionary keys are maintained by sort ascending order, the internal representation does not always match the order in which the keys are installed. When a reference by index, the value or key that is returned will reflect the internal ordering of the Dictionary or Directory:
